hiringOrganization.name: California Institute Of Technology Jet Propulsion Laboratory

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

In this position, you will be a member of the Facilities Planning and Office Amenities Group and will report to the Group Supervisor.  You will work closely with the Engineering and Design, Project Administration and Construction Administration Groups in the planning and execution of organizational moves, be liaison between Requester, Facilities, and JPL Service Providers involved in the relocation of personnel and equipment in addition to supporting smaller reconfiguration/construction projects. You will provide space utilization planning, feasibility, cost, scheduling and assisting in the coordination of moving these personnel and equipment.

Job duties will include, but are not limited to the following:

  • As a Facilities Planner you will coordinate a variety of multidiscipline facilities projects, in a customer focused environment.

  • Directs multiple wide-ranging complex tasks including, but not limited to: defining the project scope, deliverables, schedules, budgets, and the task list.

  • Leads remodel and collocation projects with internal and external organizations and a variety of members on the project team.

  • Assembles project team members.Conducts project kickoff, steering committee, and team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and other project meeting facilitation.

The following qualifications are required:

  • Typically requires a Bachelors degree in a related field with a minimum of 6 years of related experience; or Masters degree in similar disciplines with a minimum of 4 years of related experience. Strong experience with planning and coordination of facilities reconfiguration/relocation projects that are multidimensional or cross disciplinary in nature.

  • Extensive knowledge in general design and construction, reading and interpreting construction documents and drawings. Strong working knowledge of applicable ADA requirements, and California building code.

  • Extensive understanding of modular furniture layout, principles of spatial planning, and installation practices.

  • Thorough knowledge of multiple modular furniture systems, specifically Knoll Equity, Dividends and Reff.

  • Demonstrated experience coordinating a variety of multidiscipline facilities projects in a customer focused environment.

  • Able to work independently on key projects and assignments with only limited direction, typically receiving few or no instructions.

  • Able to exercise independent sound judgment and discretion, have problem solving skills, be able to plan, have excellent oral and written communications skills that foster a cooperative spirit, work well under pressure, take initiative, and be flexible.

  • Strong organizational skills and demonstrated ability to orchestrate professional consultants and contractors.

  • Knowledge and experience with software applications to manage projects and scheduling as well as proficient in the use of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Project, etc.).

  • Ability to obtain a TS/SCI clearance.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with NASA policies and procedures, Laboratory policies and procedures, the Facilities Design Standards, and accounting processes.

  • Familiar with JPL’s lab layout.

  • Competence with Oracle Enterprise Business Systems.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks

The hiring range displayed below is specifically for those who will work in or reside in the location listed. In extending an offer, Jet Propulsion Laboratory considers factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s job related skills, experience, knowledge, and relevant education/training. Hiring range for this job may be adjusted based on primary work location outside of Pasadena, California. This adjusted range will be provided to candidates by the Recruiter when applicable.

The typical full time equivalent annual hiring range for this job in Pasadena, California.

$98,696 - $122,096

JPL is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy or perceived pregnancy, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, protected military or veteran status or any other characteristic or condition protected by Federal, state or local law.

In addition, JPL is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

EEO is the Law.

EEO is the Law Supplement

Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision

The Jet Propulsion Laboratory is a federal facility. Due to rules imposed by NASA, JPL will not accept applications from citizens of designated countries or those born in a designated country unless they are Legal Permanent Residents of the U.S or have other protected status under 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3). The Designated Countries List is available here.
